intro: Erodium aethiopicum subsp. aethiopicum, commonly known as common bedstraw, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pink or reddish flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
